item.title: Bears Can Face Summer Challenges In Roadside Zoos
item.description: August 17, 2017 - Even when the Animal Welfare Act is followed, bears may not live in conditions that many would find reasonable for such large, intelligent animals to flourish, says anthropologist Barbara J. King.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 17, 2017 - Even when the Animal Welfare Act is followed, bears may not live in conditions that many would find reasonable for such large, intelligent animals to flourish, says anthropologist Barbara J. King. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/17/543682389/bears-can-face-summer-challenges-in-roadside-zoos

item.title: Chemists Say You Should Add A Little Water To Your Whiskey. Here's Why
item.description: August 17, 2017 - It's a common refrain from whiskey enthusiasts: Adding a few drops of water to a glass opens up the flavors of the drink. Chemists in Sweden provide a molecular explanation for why this works.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 17, 2017 - It's a common refrain from whiskey enthusiasts: Adding a few drops of water to a glass opens up the flavors of the drink. Chemists in Sweden provide a molecular explanation for why this works. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/17/543902701/chemists-say-you-should-add-a-little-water-to-your-whisky-here-s-why

item.title: Rituals To Sprinkle A Little Magic Into Your Eclipse Experience
item.description:
August 17, 2017 - A slightly witch-y mother, an astrologer, and the co-writer of a guide for Basic Witches share their eclipse rituals.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/17/543634260/rituals-to-sprinkle-a-little-magic-into-your-eclipse-experience
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Make Your Own Eclipse Viewer
item.description:
August 17, 2017 - No eclipse glasses? No problem. Make your own solar viewer; (almost) no tools required.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/17/543633362/make-your-own-eclipse-viewer
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Probiotic Bacteria Could Protect Newborns From Deadly Infection
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Each year more than 600,000 babies die of sepsis. Researchers have found a simple way to prevent it: Feed babies probiotic bacteria that are common in kimchi, pickles and other fermented vegetables.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Each year more than 600,000 babies die of sepsis. Researchers have found a simple way to prevent it: Feed babies probiotic bacteria that are common in kimchi, pickles and other fermented vegetables. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/08/16/543920822/probiotic-bacteria-could-protect-newborns-from-deadly-infection

item.title: With Heavy Drinking On The Rise, How Much Is Too Much?
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Binge-drinking sounds like an all-night bender, but here's a reality check: Many social drinkers may "binge" without knowing it. Women who drink four or more drinks on an occasion are binge-drinking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Binge-drinking sounds like an all-night bender, but here's a reality check: Many social drinkers may "binge" without knowing it. Women who drink four or more drinks on an occasion are binge-drinking. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/16/543965637/women-who-love-wine-are-you-binge-drinking-without-realizing-it

item.title: Trump Rolls Back Obama-Era Flood Standards For Infrastructure Projects
item.description: August 16, 2017 - An Obama order called for new public infrastructure projects to be built to withstand rising sea levels caused by climate change. President Trump revoked that order to accelerate the review process.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - An Obama order called for new public infrastructure projects to be built to withstand rising sea levels caused by climate change. President Trump revoked that order to accelerate the review process. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/543712263/trump-rolls-back-obama-era-flood-standards-for-infrastructure-projects

item.title: The Best Item In An Astronaut's Care Package? Definitely The Ice Cream
item.description: August 16, 2017 - Unlike other cargo vehicles, the SpaceX spacecraft can return to Earth without burning up. So it's equipped with freezers for transporting medical samples — and the occasional frozen treat.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Unlike other cargo vehicles, the SpaceX spacecraft can return to Earth without burning up. So it's equipped with freezers for transporting medical samples — and the occasional frozen treat. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/16/543980504/the-best-item-in-an-astronaut-s-care-package-definitely-the-ice-cream

item.title: NASA Astronauts Set To Get Sweet Treat With Next Delivery To International Space Station
item.description: August 16, 2017 - This week, a rocket bound for the International Space Station lifted off with 6,400 pounds of supplies. Along with the provisions, medical supplies and experiments, NASA astronauts will be getting a special care package with ice cream.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - This week, a rocket bound for the International Space Station lifted off with 6,400 pounds of supplies. Along with the provisions, medical supplies and experiments, NASA astronauts will be getting a special care package with ice cream. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/543973258/nasa-astronauts-set-to-get-sweet-treat-with-next-delivery-to-international-space

item.title: At CERN, Hunting For Invisible Worlds
item.description: August 16, 2017 - With so many dedicated to solving nature's riddles at CERN, it's hard not to think of it as a modern cathedral, a link between reason and mystery, a place of pilgrimage, says blogger Marcelo Gleiser.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - With so many dedicated to solving nature's riddles at CERN, it's hard not to think of it as a modern cathedral, a link between reason and mystery, a place of pilgrimage, says blogger Marcelo Gleiser. http://www.npr.org/sections/13.7/2017/08/16/543928634/at-cern-hunting-for-invisible-worlds

item.title: United By The Sun: A Solar Event For All Americans To Share (Rebroadcast)
item.description:
August 16, 2017 - Skywatchers and astrophysicists are already gearing up for next month's "Great American Solar Eclipse."

item.title: Here's What You Need To Know About The Total Solar Eclipse
item.description:
August 16, 2017 - As America prepares for the eclipse on Aug. 21, here are some basic facts about the phenomenon.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/16/541132645/heres-what-you-need-to-know-about-the-total-solar-eclipse

item.title: How Eclipses Changed History
item.description:
August 16, 2017 - Newton and Einstein had big ideas, but needed an eclipse to prove them. And scientists are still pursuing secrets of the universe one eclipse at a time.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/543532422/how-eclipses-changed-history
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 16, 2017 - Newton and Einstein had big ideas, but needed an eclipse to prove them. And scientists are still pursuing secrets of the universe one eclipse at a time. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/16/543532422/how-eclipses-changed-history

item.title: Scientists Move To Establish Wildlife Preserve At Guantanamo Bay
item.description: August 15, 2017 - In the 15 years since the Guantanamo Bay detention camp was established to house suspected terrorists, a green buffer surrounding the facility to keep out the world has reverted back to the wild. Now some scientists would like to turn it into a protected research area.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - In the 15 years since the Guantanamo Bay detention camp was established to house suspected terrorists, a green buffer surrounding the facility to keep out the world has reverted back to the wild. Now some scientists would like to turn it into a protected research area. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/15/543730262/scientists-move-to-establish-wildlife-preserve-at-guantanamo-bay

item.title: Can We Feed The World With Farmed Fish?
item.description: August 15, 2017 - New research suggests there is space on the open ocean to farm essentially all the seafood humans can eat — and then some. But such volumes of fish and shellfish could not be grown without costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 15, 2017 - New research suggests there is space on the open ocean to farm essentially all the seafood humans can eat — and then some. But such volumes of fish and shellfish could not be grown without costs. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/15/543675398/can-we-feed-the-world-with-farmed-fish
